item.title: Sperm donation giant California Cryobank warns of a data breach
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: US sperm donor giant California Cryobank is warning customers it suffered a data breach that exposed customers' personal information. [...]

item.title: GitHub Action hack likely led to another in cascading supply chain attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A cascading supply chain attack that began with the compromise of the "reviewdog/action-setup@v1" GitHub Action is believed to have led to the recent breach of "tj-actions/changed-files" that leaked CI/CD secrets. [...]

item.title: Western Alliance Bank notifies 21,899 customers of data breach
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Arizona-based Western Alliance Bank is notifying nearly 22,000 customers their personal information was stolen in October after a third-party vendor's secure file transfer software was breached. [...]

item.title: Malicious Android 'Vapor' apps on Google Play installed 60 million times
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Over 300 malicious Android applications downloaded 60 million items from Google Play acted as adware or attempted to steal credentials and credit card information. [...]

item.title: New Windows zero-day exploited by 11 state hacking groups since 2017
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: At least 11 state-backed hacking groups from North Korea, Iran, Russia, and China have been exploiting a new Windows vulnerability in data theft and cyber espionage zero-day attacks since 2017. [...]

item.title: Google to purchase Wiz for $32 billion in cloud security play
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Google has announced it entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Wiz, a leading cloud security platform, for $32 billion in an all-cash transaction. [...]

item.title: Critical AMI MegaRAC bug can let attackers hijack, brick servers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​A new critical severity vulnerability found in American Megatrends International's MegaRAC Baseboard Management Controller (BMC) software can let attackers hijack and potentially brick vulnerable servers. [...]

item.title: Blockchain gaming platform WEMIX hacked to steal $6.1 million
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Blockchain gaming platform WEMIX suffered a cyberattack last month, allowing threat actors to steal 8,654,860 WEMIX tokens, valued at approximately $6,100,000 at the time. [...]

item.title: Telegram CEO leaves France temporarily as criminal probe continues
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: French authorities have allowed Pavel Durov, Telegram's CEO and founder, to temporarily leave the country while criminal activity on the messaging platform is still under investigation. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: New RAT malware used for crypto theft, reconnaissance
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has discovered a new remote access trojan (RAT) that employs "sophisticated techniques" to avoid detection, maintain persistence, and extract sensitive data. [...]

item.title: OKX suspends DEX aggregator after Lazarus hackers try to launder funds
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: OKX Web3 has decided to suspend its DEX aggregator services to implement security upgrades following reports of abuse by the notorious North Korean Lazarus hackers, who recently conducted a $1.5 billion crypto heist. [...]

item.title: Supply chain attack on popular GitHub Action exposes CI/CD secrets
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A supply chain attack on the widely used 'tj-actions/changed-files' GitHub Action, used by 23,000 repositories, potentially allowed threat actors to steal CI/CD secrets from GitHub Actions build logs. [...]
